instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message:
Hi everyone, 
I've got MacBook Pro after other repair centre tried replace flickering screen since than laptop is not powering on, caps lock is not blinking touch bar not lighting up. 
There is activity on all ports voltage jump to 20V and 2.3 A is taking by board when battery is connected 
I noticed that CPU getting hot 
voltage on 
L7410 0,6V
L7210 0.9V
L7220 0.9V 
L7270 1.05V
L8000 1V
L8050 1V
PP3v3sus 3.4V 
It looks like should power on but it does not I tried with new screen issue persist.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message:
Why the people seacrh only for video to see if a board boots???
What happens if there is a video problem?
Did you check for USB activity?

One board can boot and has video problem, as unique issue.
Booting board can also have only USB fault (with good video).
But, how many boards do you think will boot and have video and USB problems at same time???
In such case is almost sure the board doesn't really boot.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message: I've checked there is activity on USB mouse lighting up and stays on

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message:
That is not sufficient.
At least see if mouse get light if reconnect/deisconnect when board is turned on.
The best test is with an USB OSX pendrive with Link LED; if flashes, there is activity 100%.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message: have checked with hdd when powering on light blinks and than constant light no blinking, I've tried boot it up with "alt"  as it will go to boot menu

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering on
threads.message:
Then don't waste the time searching for video; the board doesn't even boot.

God knows what they did in other service.
Inspect for knocked off components, or broken traces.

Disconnect any flex from MLB and check USB activity only.
